seriesJson.title: Coming of age
seriesJson.description: Explores the thoughts and feelings of American youth in the 20th century. Writer-director Ben Park talks with teenagers and parents, teachers and friends.

node.title: What are teenagers made of
node.description: A kaleidoscopic cross-section of teenage thought and opinion. The program features a guest appearance by Margaret Mead.

node.title: Three in a gang
node.description: Teenage fighting gang members talk about what they do.

node.title: Vic wants to be an actor
node.description: From family and church, Vic has drawn strength to make decisions even when they conflict with his religion and family background.

node.title: Jim and his old man
node.description: Jim's father appears to resent him. Why?

node.title: Barbara joined the Al-a-Teen
node.description: In the Al-a-Teen, an organization of children of alcoholics, Barbara tried to find some meaning in the tensions that surround her and her family.

node.title: Joanne goes back to Grandma
node.description: Whenever her father gets drunk Joanne is sent to Grandma for a while in, this, another "coming of age" vignette.

node.title: Rita looks for older men
node.description: This program explores why a certain young woman prefers older men and what it means. Bertram Schaffner is a featured guest.

node.title: Joey has his doubts
node.description: A glimpse of one young man coming of age amid tensions of status.

node.title: The rocking rebel
node.description: What are the meanings behind the musical addictions of teenagers? A brief history and interpretation of "outlaw music" and rock and roll. Alan Lomax is a featured guest.

node.title: Five for segregation
node.description: This program presents a capsule view of upper class, articulate, southern youth and its world.

node.title: Five sat down
node.description: This program is a documentary of a headline integration incident.

node.title: Suburbia sees the dawn
node.description: A successful teenage movement for control of drinking and driving is analyzed.

node.title: Suburbia in dismay
node.description: Teenage drinking and fast driving continue despite parental interference. Includes an interview with Margaret Mead.
